questions.question: There ……………………… an explosion in the city.
questions.description: When there is no time reference, we use the present perfect to talk about finished events.

questions.question: The terrorists …………………………. the bridge.
questions.description: To blow  something up is to cause it to explode.

questions.question: We …………………………. the job by next Monday.
questions.description: The future perfect is used to say that an action will have been completed by a particular point of time in future.

questions.question: She ………………………… by the time I reached her place.
questions.description: The past perfect is used for the earlier of two past actions.

questions.question: He didn’t let me …………………………..
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You haven’t …………………….. for your drinks.
questions.description: Paid is the past participle of pay.

questions.question: The firemen were called in to ………………………… the fire
questions.description: To put out is to extinguish.

questions.question: How beautifully …………………………..!
questions.description: In exclamations, the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: Tell me what ………………………… in my room.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary goes after the subject.

questions.question: You ……………………… not pick up a fight with him.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: We started early so that we ………………………. miss the bus.
That dog of ………………………… has bitten me again.
